definition: guests feel at home (in a hotel, guest house etc)/a home away from home
visitor/guest/object (in grammar)
to arrive/most/to/until
as/as if/such as
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: The room had a cozy, homelike atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这房间有一种宾至如归的舒适氛围。

sentences.english: All travellers find this hotel a home from home.
sentences.chinese: 在这家饭店住宿的旅客都有宾至如归的感觉。

sentences.english: I did not feel welcome outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 我在这扇门之外并没有宾至如归的感觉。

sentences.english: Ruben, the host, made all the arrangements and requested his wife to prepare dinner and make Bernard feel at home.
sentences.chinese: 并要太太准备丰富的餐点，让伯纳感到宾至如归。

sentences.english: And, indeed, Zi Fi is a restaurant designed to make the successful businessman feel at home.
sentences.chinese: 子非会馆确实是一个能够让成功商人宾至如归的地方。

sentences.english: "I feel at home when I am in Egypt, " said Wen.
sentences.chinese: 我来到埃及大有宾至如归的感觉。

sentences.english: We wish you can talk heart-to-heart, and receive home feeling.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望你能心连心地交流，宾至如归。

definition: comfortable/happy
hospitality/to treat guests well/to enjoy having guests/hospitable/friendly
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to provide warm hospitality
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
to welcome sb with a smiling face (idiom)
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
the customer reigns supreme (idiom)
lit. clear window and clean table (idiom)/fig. bright and clean
thoughtful/considerate/attentive/thorough/also pr. [zhou1 dao5]
to entertain/to be hospitable to
to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
amiable/cordial/close and dear/familiar
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to act as host/to do the honors
